common.tagline: Science-backed food safety information for dogs and cats. Know what's safe before you share!

search.placeholder: Search for a food (e.g., chocolate, grapes, chicken...)
search.checking: Checking if it's safe for your {{petType}}...

safety.disclaimer: This information is for general guidance only. Always consult with your veterinarian for specific dietary advice for your pet.

about.title: About Us
about.subtitle: We're dedicated to keeping your furry friends safe and healthy by providing accurate, science-backed food safety information.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: To empower pet owners with reliable, easy-to-understand information about what foods are safe for their pets. We believe every pet deserves a healthy diet, and every owner deserves peace of mind.

science.title: Science-Backed
science.description: Our food safety information is powered by AI trained on veterinary research, peer-reviewed studies, and expert recommendations from animal nutrition specialists.

love.title: Built with Love
love.description: Created by pet lovers, for pet lovers. We understand the special bond between you and your furry companions, and we're here to help you keep them happy and healthy.

community.title: Community Driven
community.description: We continuously improve our platform based on feedback from pet owners and veterinary professionals. Your input helps us serve the pet community better.

disclaimer.title: Important Disclaimer
disclaimer.description: While we strive to provide accurate and up-to-date information, our tool should not replace professional veterinary advice. If your pet has consumed something potentially harmful, please contact your veterinarian or an emergency animal poison control center immediately.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions about our pet food safety checker.

accuracy.question: How accurate is the food safety information?
accuracy.answer: Our information is powered by AI trained on veterinary research, scientific studies, and expert recommendations. However, we always recommend consulting with your veterinarian for specific dietary concerns, especially if your pet has health conditions or allergies.

emergency.question: Can I trust this tool for emergency situations?
emergency.answer: While our tool provides helpful information, it should not be used as a substitute for professional veterinary care in emergencies. If your pet has ingested something potentially harmful, contact your veterinarian or an emergency animal poison control center immediately.

difference.question: Why does the safety rating differ between dogs and cats?
difference.answer: Dogs and cats have different digestive systems and metabolic processes. Some foods that are safe for dogs can be toxic to cats, and vice versa. That's why we provide species-specific safety ratings for accurate guidance.

levels.question: What do the safety levels mean?
levels.answer: We use three safety levels: Safe (green) means the food is generally safe for consumption in appropriate amounts. Caution (yellow) means the food may be okay in small quantities but has some risks. Dangerous (red) means the food is toxic or harmful and should be avoided completely.

updates.question: How often is the information updated?
updates.answer: Our AI model is regularly updated with the latest veterinary research and nutritional studies. We continuously work to improve the accuracy and comprehensiveness of our food safety database.

suggest.question: Can I suggest a food to be added?
suggest.answer: Absolutely! We're always looking to expand our database. Use our contact form to suggest foods you'd like us to cover, and we'll work on adding them to our system.

free.question: Is this service free?
free.answer: Yes! Our basic food safety checker is completely free to use. We believe every pet owner should have access to important food safety information.

dangerous.question: What should I do if my pet eats something dangerous?
dangerous.answer: If your pet consumes a dangerous food, don't panic. Note what they ate and how much, then immediately contact your veterinarian or call the ASPCA Animal Poison Control Center at (888) 426-4435 (US). Time is critical in poisoning cases.

contact.title: Contact Us
contact.subtitle: Have questions, suggestions, or feedback? We'd love to hear from you!

form.name: Your Name
form.messagePlaceholder: Tell us what's on your mind...
form.success: Message sent! We'll get back to you soon.

safeFoods.title: Safe Foods Guide
safeFoods.subtitle: A comprehensive list of foods that are generally safe for your pets when given in appropriate amounts.

warning.title: Important Reminder
warning.description: While these foods are generally safe, always introduce new foods gradually and in moderation. Every pet is unique, and some may have individual sensitivities or allergies. When in doubt, consult your veterinarian.

emergency.title: Emergency Contacts
emergency.subtitle: Important numbers to have on hand if your pet ingests something harmful.

trending.title: Trending Now
trending.affiliateDisclosure: We may earn a small commission from qualifying purchases. Prices may vary by region.
